title: Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket
name: Bucket
description: Buckets are the basic containers that hold your data. Everything that you store in Google Cloud Storage must be contained in a bucket.

params.name: connection
params.description: Represents a connection to Cloud Storage.

params.name: name
params.description: The bucket's name.

params.name: info
params.description: The bucket's metadata.

methods.name: acl
methods.description: Configure ACL for this bucket.

returns.description: An ACL instance configured to handle the bucket's access control policies.

methods.name: defaultAcl
methods.description: Configure default object ACL for this bucket.

returns.description: An ACL instance configured to handle the bucket's default object access control policies.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check whether or not the bucket exists.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: upload
methods.description: Upload your data in a simple fashion. Uploads will default to being resumable if the file size is greater than 5mb.

examples.caption: Upload an object in a resumable fashion while setting a new name for the object and including the content language.
Upload an object with a customer-supplied encryption key.
Upload an object utilizing an encryption key managed by the Cloud Key Management Service (KMS).

resources.title: crc32c PHP extension for hardware-accelerated validation hashes.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination. Required when data is of type string or null.

params.name: options.resumable
params.description: Indicates whether or not the upload will be performed in a resumable fashion.

params.name: options.validate
params.description: Indicates whether or not validation will be applied using md5 or crc32c hashing functionality. If enabled, and the calculated hash does not match that of the upstream server, the upload will be rejected. Available options are true, false, md5 and crc32. If true, either md5 or crc32c will be chosen based on your platform. If false, no validation hash will be sent. Choose either md5 or crc32 to force a hash method regardless of performance implications. In PHP versions earlier than 7.4, performance will be very adversely impacted by using crc32c unless you install the crc32c PHP extension. Defaults to true.

params.name: options.chunkSize
params.description: If provided the upload will be done in chunks. The size must be in multiples of 262144 bytes. With chunking you have increased reliability at the risk of higher overhead. It is recommended to not use chunking.

params.name: options.uploadProgressCallback
params.description: If provided together with $resumable == true the given callable function/method will be called after each successfully uploaded chunk. The callable function/method will receive the number of uploaded bytes after each uploaded chunk as a parameter to this callable. It's useful if you want to create a progress bar when using resumable upload type together with $chunkSize parameter. If $chunkSize is not set the callable function/method will be called only once after the successful file upload.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The full list of available options are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.metadata.metadata
params.description: User-provided metadata, in key/value pairs.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. If you would prefer to manage encryption utilizing the Cloud Key Management Service (KMS) please use the $metadata.kmsKeyName setting. Please note if using KMS the key ring must use the same location as the bucket.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

methods.name: uploadAsync
methods.description:
Asynchronously uploads an object.

Please note this method does not support resumable or streaming uploads.

examples.caption: Upload multiple objects to a bucket asynchronously.

resources.title: crc32c PHP extension for hardware-accelerated validation hashes.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination. Required when data is of type string or null.

params.name: options.validate
params.description: Indicates whether or not validation will be applied using md5 or crc32c hashing functionality. If enabled, and the calculated hash does not match that of the upstream server, the upload will be rejected. Available options are true, false, md5 and crc32. If true, either md5 or crc32c will be chosen based on your platform. If false, no validation hash will be sent. Choose either md5 or crc32 to force a hash method regardless of performance implications. In PHP versions earlier than 7.4, performance will be very adversely impacted by using crc32c unless you install the crc32c PHP extension. Defaults to true.ß

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The full list of available options are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.metadata.metadata
params.description: User-provided metadata, in key/value pairs.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. If you would prefer to manage encryption utilizing the Cloud Key Management Service (KMS) please use the $metadata.kmsKeyName setting. Please note if using KMS the key ring must use the same location as the bucket.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

methods.name: getResumableUploader
methods.description: Get a resumable uploader which can provide greater control over the upload process. This is recommended when dealing with large files where reliability is key.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination. Required when data is of type string or null.

params.name: options.validate
params.description: Indicates whether or not validation will be applied using md5 hashing functionality. If true and the calculated hash does not match that of the upstream server the upload will be rejected.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. If you would prefer to manage encryption utilizing the Cloud Key Management Service (KMS) please use the $metadata['kmsKeyName'] setting. Please note if using KMS the key ring must use the same location as the bucket.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

params.name: options.uploadProgressCallback
params.description: The given callable function/method will be called after each successfully uploaded chunk. The callable function/method will receive the number of uploaded bytes after each uploaded chunk as a parameter to this callable. It's useful if you want to create a progress bar when using resumable upload type together with $chunkSize parameter. If $chunkSize is not set the callable function/method will be called only once after the successful file upload.

methods.name: getStreamableUploader
methods.description: Get a streamable uploader which can provide greater control over the upload process. This is useful for generating large files and uploading the contents in chunks.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination. Required when data is of type string or null.

params.name: options.validate
params.description: Indicates whether or not validation will be applied using md5 hashing functionality. If true and the calculated hash does not match that of the upstream server the upload will be rejected.

params.name: options.chunkSize
params.description: If provided the upload will be done in chunks. The size must be in multiples of 262144 bytes. With chunking you have increased reliability at the risk of higher overhead. It is recommended to not use chunking.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. If you would prefer to manage encryption utilizing the Cloud Key Management Service (KMS) please use the $metadata['kmsKeyName'] setting. Please note if using KMS the key ring must use the same location as the bucket.

methods.name: object
methods.description: Lazily instantiates an object. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on an object please see Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the object to request.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: Request a specific revision of the object.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

methods.name: objects
methods.description: Fetches all objects in the bucket.

examples.caption: Get all objects beginning with the prefix 'photo'

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.delimiter
params.description: Returns results in a directory-like mode. Results will contain only objects whose names, aside from the prefix, do not contain delimiter. Objects whose names, aside from the prefix, contain delimiter will have their name, truncated after the delimiter, returned in prefixes. Duplicate prefixes are omitted.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request. Defaults to 1000.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: options.prefix
params.description: Filter results with this prefix.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

params.name: options.versions
params.description: If true, lists all versions of an object as distinct results. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Selector which will cause the response to only return the specified fields.

methods.name: createNotification
methods.description:
Create a Cloud PubSub notification.

Please note, the desired topic must be given the IAM role of "pubsub.publisher" from the service account associated with the project which contains the bucket you would like to receive notifications from. Please see the example below for a programmatic example of achieving this.

examples.caption: Update the permissions on the desired topic prior to creating the notification.
Provide a Topic object from the Cloud PubSub component.
Supplying event types to trigger the notifications.

params.name: topic
params.description: The topic used to publish notifications.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.custom_attributes
params.description: An optional list of additional attributes to attach to each Cloud PubSub message published for this notification subscription.

params.name: options.event_types
params.description: If present, only send notifications about listed event types. If empty, sent notifications for all event types. Acceptablue values include "OBJECT_FINALIZE", "OBJECT_METADATA_UPDATE", "OBJECT_DELETE" , "OBJECT_ARCHIVE".

params.name: options.object_name_prefix
params.description: If present, only apply this notification configuration to object names that begin with this prefix.

params.name: options.payload_format
params.description: The desired content of the Payload. Acceptable values include "JSON_API_V1", "NONE". Defaults to "JSON_API_V1".

exceptions.description: When providing a type other than string or Google\Cloud\PubSub\Topic as $topic.
When a project ID has not been detected.

methods.name: notification
methods.description: Lazily instantiates a notification. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a notification please see Google\Cloud\Storage\Notification.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the notification to access.

methods.name: notifications
methods.description: Fetches all notifications associated with this bucket.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete the bucket.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: If set, only deletes the bucket if its metageneration matches this value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: If set, only deletes the bucket if its metageneration does not match this value.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update the bucket. Upon receiving a result the local bucket's data will be updated.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the bucket. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.predefinedDefaultObjectAcl
params.description: Apply a predefined set of default object access controls to this bucket. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Selector which will cause the response to only return the specified fields.

params.name: options.acl
params.description: Access controls on the bucket.

params.name: options.cors
params.description: The bucket's Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) configuration.

params.name: options.defaultObjectAcl
params.description: Default access controls to apply to new objects when no ACL is provided.

params.name: options.lifecycle
params.description: The bucket's lifecycle configuration.

params.name: options.logging
params.description: The bucket's logging configuration, which defines the destination bucket and optional name prefix for the current bucket's logs.

params.name: options.storageClass
params.description: The bucket's storage class. This defines how objects in the bucket are stored and determines the SLA and the cost of storage. Acceptable values include the following strings: "STANDARD", "NEARLINE", "COLDLINE" and "ARCHIVE". Legacy values including "MULTI_REGIONAL", "REGIONAL" and "DURABLE_REDUCED_AVAILABILITY" are also available, but should be avoided for new implementations. For more information, refer to the Storage Classes documentation. Defaults to "STANDARD".

params.name: options.autoclass
params.description: The bucket's autoclass configuration. Buckets can have either StorageClass OLM rules or Autoclass, but not both. When Autoclass is enabled on a bucket, adding StorageClass OLM rules will result in failure.

params.name: options.versioning
params.description: The bucket's versioning configuration.

params.name: options.website
params.description: The bucket's website configuration.

params.name: options.billing
params.description: The bucket's billing configuration.

params.name: options.billing.requesterPays
params.description: When true, requests to this bucket and objects within it must provide a project ID to which the request will be billed.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: The Bucket labels. Labels are represented as an array of keys and values. To remove an existing label, set its value to null.

params.name: options.encryption
params.description: Encryption configuration used by default for newly inserted objects.

params.name: options.encryption.defaultKmsKeyName
params.description: A Cloud KMS Key used to encrypt objects uploaded into this bucket. Should be in the format projects/my-project/locations/kr-location/keyRings/my-kr/cryptoKeys/my-key. Please note the KMS key ring must use the same location as the bucket.

params.name: options.defaultEventBasedHold
params.description: When true, newly created objects in this bucket will be retained indefinitely until an event occurs, signified by the hold's release.

params.name: options.retentionPolicy
params.description: Defines the retention policy for a bucket. In order to lock a retention policy, please see Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::lockRetentionPolicy().

params.name: options.retentionPolicy.retentionPeriod
params.description: Specifies the duration that objects need to be retained, in seconds. Retention duration must be greater than zero and less than 100 years.

params.name: options.iamConfiguration
params.description: The bucket's IAM configuration.

params.name: options.iamConfiguration.bucketPolicyOnly.enabled
params.description: this is an alias for $iamConfiguration.uniformBucketLevelAccess.

params.name: options.iamConfiguration.uniformBucketLevelAccess.enabled
params.description: If set and true, access checks only use bucket-level IAM policies or above. When enabled, requests attempting to view or manipulate ACLs will fail with error code 400. NOTE: Before using Uniform bucket-level access, please review the feature documentation, as well as Should You Use uniform bucket-level access

params.name: options.iamConfiguration.publicAccessPrevention
params.description: The bucket's Public Access Prevention configuration. Currently, 'inherited' and 'enforced' are supported. defaults to inherited. For more details, see Public Access Prevention.

methods.name: compose
methods.description:
Composes a set of objects into a single object.

Please note that all objects to be composed must come from the same bucket.

params.name: sourceObjects
params.description: The objects to compose.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the composed object.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the composed object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: Metadata to apply to the composed object. The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.ifGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration matches the given value.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Retrieves the bucket's details. If no bucket data is cached a network request will be made to retrieve it.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Triggers a network request to reload the bucket's details.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

methods.name: name
methods.description: Retrieves the bucket's name.

methods.name: lifecycle
methods.description:
Retrieves a fresh lifecycle builder. If a lifecyle configuration already exists on the target bucket and this builder is used, it will fully replace the configuration with the rules provided by this builder.

This builder is intended to be used in tandem with Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageClient::createBucket() and Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::update().

params.name: lifecycle
params.description: A lifecycle configuration. Please see here for the expected structure.

methods.name: currentLifecycle
methods.description:
Retrieves a lifecycle builder preconfigured with the lifecycle rules that already exists on the bucket. Use this if you want to make updates to an existing configuration without removing existing rules, as would be the case when using Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::lifecycle().

This builder is intended to be used in tandem with Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageClient::createBucket() and Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::update().

Please note, this method may trigger a network request in order to fetch the existing lifecycle rules from the server.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: isWritable
methods.description:
Returns whether the bucket with the given file prefix is writable.

Tries to create a temporary file as a resumable upload which will not be completed (and cleaned up by GCS).

params.name: file
params.description: File to try to write.

methods.name: iam
methods.description:
Manage the IAM policy for the current Bucket.

To request a policy with conditions, pass an array with '[requestedPolicyVersion => 3]' as argument to the policy() and reload() methods.

methods.name: lockRetentionPolicy
methods.description:
Locks a provided retention policy on this bucket. Upon receiving a result, the local bucket's data will be updated.

Please note that in order for this call to succeed, the applicable metageneration value will need to be available. It can either be supplied explicitly through the ifMetagenerationMatch option or detected for you by ensuring a value is cached locally (by calling Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::reload() or Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::info(), for example).

examples.caption: Set a retention policy.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Only locks the retention policy if the bucket's metageneration matches this value. If not provided the locally cached metageneration value will be used, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

exceptions.description: If no metageneration value is available.

methods.name: signedUrl
methods.description: Create a Signed URL listing objects in this bucket.

params.name: expires
params.description: Specifies when the URL will expire. May provide an instance of Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp, http://php.net/datetimeimmutable, or a UNIX timestamp as an integer.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.cname
params.description: The CNAME for the bucket, for instance https://cdn.example.com. Defaults to https://storage.googleapis.com.

params.name: options.contentMd5
params.description: The MD5 digest value in base64. If you provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same value in its request. If provided, take care to always provide this value as a base64 encoded string.

params.name: options.contentType
params.description: If you provide this value, the client must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

params.name: options.forceOpenssl
params.description: If true, OpenSSL will be used regardless of whether phpseclib is available. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.headers
params.description: If additional headers are provided, the server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values. Provide headers as a key/value array, where the key is the header name, and the value is an array of header values. Headers with multiple values may provide values as a simple array, or a comma-separated string. For a reference of allowed headers, see Reference Headers. Header values will be trimmed of leading and trailing spaces, multiple spaces within values will be collapsed to a single space, and line breaks will be replaced by an empty string. V2 Signed URLs may not provide x-goog-encryption-key or x-goog-encryption-key-sha256 headers.

params.name: options.keyFile
params.description: Keyfile data to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed. If $options.keyFilePath is set, this option is ignored.

params.name: options.keyFilePath
params.description: A path to a valid keyfile to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed.

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: One or more authentication scopes to be used with a key file. This option is ignored unless $options.keyFile or $options.keyFilePath is set.

params.name: options.queryParams
params.description: Additional query parameters to be included as part of the signed URL query string. For allowed values, see Reference Headers.

params.name: options.version
params.description: One of "v2" or "v4". *Defaults to** "v2".

exceptions.description: If the given expiration is invalid or in the past.
If the given `$options.method` is not valid.
If the given `$options.keyFilePath` is not valid.
If the given custom headers are invalid.
If the keyfile does not contain the required information.

methods.name: generateSignedPostPolicyV4
methods.description:
Create a signed upload policy for uploading objects.

This method generates and signs a policy document. You can use policy documents to allow visitors to a website to upload files to Google Cloud Storage without giving them direct write access.

Google Cloud PHP does not support v2 post policies.

params.name: objectName
params.description: The path to the file in Google Cloud Storage, relative to the bucket.

params.name: expires
params.description: Specifies when the URL will expire. May provide an instance of Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp, http://php.net/datetimeimmutable, or a UNIX timestamp as an integer.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options

params.name: options.bucketBoundHostname
params.description: The hostname for the bucket, for instance cdn.example.com. May be used for Google Cloud Load Balancers or for custom bucket CNAMEs. Defaults to storage.googleapis.com.

params.name: options.conditions
params.description: A list of arrays containing policy matching conditions (e.g. eq, starts-with, content-length-range).

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Additional form fields (do not include x-goog-signature, file, policy or fields with an x-ignore prefix), given as key/value pairs.

params.name: options.forceOpenssl
params.description: If true, OpenSSL will be used regardless of whether phpseclib is available. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.keyFile
params.description: Keyfile data to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed. If $options.keyFilePath is set, this option is ignored.

params.name: options.keyFilePath
params.description: A path to a valid Keyfile to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed.

params.name: options.scheme
params.description: Either http or https. Only used if a custom hostname is provided via $options.bucketBoundHostname. If a custom bucketBoundHostname is provided, defaults to http. In all other cases, defaults to https.

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: One or more authentication scopes to be used with a key file. This option is ignored unless $options.keyFile or $options.keyFilePath is set.

params.name: options.virtualHostedStyle
params.description: If true, URL will be of form mybucket.storage.googleapis.com. If false, storage.googleapis.com/mybucket. Defaults to false.
